Docs.summary: The Speech namespace provides access to speech-recognition services.

remarks.para: The Speech namespace, added in iOS 10, provides developers the ability to use speech recognition in their apps above-and-beyond the system-provided keyboard dictation or SiriKit.
Speech recognition is performed by a object. A speech request is encapsulated in an and an .

The is an abstract base class for , which is used with hardware devices and , which transcribes audio already stored in a URL-available resource. Developers who use objects must add the following keys, with appropriate descriptions, to their applications' info.plist file:

example.code: <key>NSMicrophoneUsageDescription</key> <string>Your microphone will be used to record your speech when you press the "Start Recording" button.</string> <key>NSSpeechRecognitionUsageDescription</key> <string>Speech recognition will be used to determine which words you speak into this device's microphone.</string>

remarks.para: If an application does not have these keys, the operating system will execute a "silent" shutdown at runtime, with no exception or ability to log the mistake.
